items.title: Opositora venezolana María Corina Machado le da la medalla de su Nobel a Trump durante su reunión
Venezuela's opposition figurehead Machado presents Trump with Nobel Peace medal
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria ⁠Corina Machado gave her Nobel Peace Prize medal to US President Donald Trump on Thursday during a White House meeting, in a bid to influence his efforts to shape her country's political future. A White House official confirmed that Trump intends to keep the medal.
items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria ⁠Corina Machado gave her Nobel Peace Prize medal to US President Donald Trump on Thursday during a White House meeting, in a bid to influence his efforts to shape her country's political future. A White House official confirmed that Trump intends to keep the medal.

items.title: Venezuela's Machado says she presented her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump during their meeting
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado said she presented her Nobel Peace Prize medal to President Donald Trump at the White House on Thursday even as he has questioned her credibility to take over her country after the U.S. ousted then-President Nicolás Maduro.

items.title: María Corina Machado presents Trump with her Nobel peace prize medal
items.standfirst: Trump heaped praise on the Venezuelan opposition leader for presenting him with ‘her Nobel peace prize for the work I have done’The Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado has presented her gold Nobel peace prize medal to Donald Trump after meeting him in the White House, nearly a fortnight after he ordered the abduction of Venezuela’s president, Nicolás Maduro.Machado, who received the award last year for her struggle against Maduro’s “brutal, authoritarian state”, told reporters on Thursday she had done so “in recognition [of] his unique commitment [to] our freedom”. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Trump to discuss Venezuela’s future with Machado after Maduro’s capture
items.standfirst: Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel prize winner had been sidelined by White House after US seized MaduroDonald Trump will host María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader and 2025 Nobel peace prize winner, at the White House on Thursday for high-stakes talks on the oil-rich nation’s future following the US capture of Nicolás Maduro.Many in Venezuela and abroad had expected Machado to take charge after an elite US military team seized Maduro in a pre-dawn raid on 3 January and transported him to a New York City jail. Continue reading...

items.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
items.standfirst: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.
items.content: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.(Image credit: Sean Kilpatrick)

items.title: Canada PM hails strategic partnership with China to adapt to ‘new global realities’
items.standfirst: Mark Carney holds talks with Xi Jinping on rare Beijing trip as Canada seeks to diversify trade links away from USBusiness live – latest updatesCanada’s prime minister, Mark Carney, has hailed a “new strategic partnership” with China as he held talks in Beijing with President Xi Jinping, the first visit by a Canadian leader in eight years.Addressing Xi in the Great Hall of the People, Carney said: “Together we can build on the best of what this relationship has been in the past to create a new one adapted to new global realities.” Continue reading...

items.title: Canada agrees to cut tariffs on Chinese EVs in a break with US
items.standfirst: Canada agreed to slash its tariffs on Chinese electric cars in return for Beijing lowering tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney announced Friday during a visit to China. Following a period of testy relations, the two countries have sought to rebuild ties after US President Donald Trump aggressively raised tariffs on Canadian products.
items.content: Canada agreed to slash its tariffs on Chinese electric cars in return for Beijing lowering tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney announced Friday during a visit to China. Following a period of testy relations, the two countries have sought to rebuild ties after US President Donald Trump aggressively raised tariffs on Canadian products.

clusters.title: South Korea sentences ex-president to five years in first martial law verdict
clusters.neutral_headline: South Korea sentences ex-president to five years in first martial law verdict

items.title: South Korea sentences ex-president to five years in first martial law verdict
items.standfirst: Yoon Suk Yeol’s conviction for obstructing own arrest separate from main trial that could lead to death penaltyA South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for mobilising presidential security forces to block his own arrest and abusing his powers. It is the first judicial ruling linked to the events surrounding his failed martial law declaration in December 2024.The ruling is separate from Yoon’s main insurrection trial, where prosecutors earlier this week sought the death penalty and a verdict is due next month. Continue reading...
items.content: Yoon Suk Yeol’s conviction for obstructing own arrest separate from main trial that could lead to death penaltyA South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison for mobilising presidential security forces to block his own arrest and abusing his powers. It is the first judicial ruling linked to the events surrounding his failed martial law declaration in December 2024.The ruling is separate from Yoon’s main insurrection trial, where prosecutors earlier this week sought the death penalty and a verdict is due next month. Continue reading...

items.title: A South Korean court sentences Yoon to 5 years in prison on charges related to martial law decree
items.standfirst: A South Korean court has sentenced former President Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison, the first verdict in eight criminal trials for allegations that include his 2024 martial law decree.
items.content: A South Korean court has sentenced former President Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison, the first verdict in eight criminal trials for allegations that include his 2024 martial law decree. (Image credit: Lee Jin-man)

items.title: South Korea’s former president found guilty in martial law case
items.standfirst: A South ‍Korean court ‍has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in jail.
items.content: A South ‍Korean court ‍has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in jail.

items.title: South Korea’s ex-president Yoon sentenced to 5 years in first of 8 trials over martial law
items.standfirst: South Korea’s former president Yoon Suk Yeol was on Friday sentenced to five years in prison in the first of eight trials related to charges over his decision to impose martial law at the end of 2024. In one of the trials, Yoon is accused of imposing the law to lead a rebellion. If he is convicted, he could be sentenced to death.
items.content: South Korea’s former president Yoon Suk Yeol was on Friday sentenced to five years in prison in the first of eight trials related to charges over his decision to impose martial law at the end of 2024. In one of the trials, Yoon is accused of imposing the law to lead a rebellion. If he is convicted, he could be sentenced to death.

items.title: Early results show Museveni leading Uganda election amid reports of violence
items.standfirst: Veteran president holding off main challenger Bobi Wine after campaign marred by violence at opposition ralliesThe veteran Ugandan president, Yoweri Museveni, held a commanding lead in early presidential election results announced on Friday, as conflicting accounts emerged of violence after the vote.Museveni, who is 81 and has ruled Uganda since seizing power in 1986, is seeking a decisive victory after a campaign marred by violence at opposition rallies. clusters.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act over protests in Minnesota
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump threatens to use Insurrection Act in Minnesota: What it means

items.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act over protests in Minnesota
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to invoke an emergency law that allows the domestic deployment of the military, after federal agents killed one person and injured another in Minnesota, sparking mass protests. Protesters have denounced the aggressive tactics of Trump's broad-reaching immigration raids in rallies in the Midwestern city, which is a Democratic stronghold.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to invoke an emergency law that allows the domestic deployment of the military, after federal agents killed one person and injured another in Minnesota, sparking mass protests. Protesters have denounced the aggressive tactics of Trump's broad-reaching immigration raids in rallies in the Midwestern city, which is a Democratic stronghold.

items.title: Trump threatens to use Insurrection Act to deploy troops to Minnesota
items.standfirst: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer​ shot a man Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after allegedly being attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.
items.content: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer​ shot a man Wednesday night in north Minneapolis after allegedly being attacked by men with shovels during an arrest operation, three U.S. officials told CBS News.

items.title: Trump threatens to use Insurrection Act in Minnesota: What it means
items.standfirst: Trump threatened to invoke the rarely used act if officials failed to quell protests against ICE agents.
items.content: Trump threatened to invoke the rarely used act if officials failed to quell protests against ICE agents.

items.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act to quell anti-ICE protests in Minnesota
items.standfirst: The rarely used law allows the president to use active-duty military personnel for law enforcement.
items.content: The rarely used law allows the president to use active-duty military personnel for law enforcement.

items.title: Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act in Minnesota as protests spread
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump threatened to activate the Insurrection Act to send military forces to Minnesota as protests escalated after federal agents shot and wounded a man and, days earlier, fatally shot a woman during immigration raids. Demonstrators condemned the use of force and broad federal immigration raids.
items.content: US President Donald Trump threatened to activate the Insurrection Act to send military forces to Minnesota as protests escalated after federal agents shot and wounded a man and, days earlier, fatally shot a woman during immigration raids. Demonstrators condemned the use of force and broad federal immigration raids.

items.title: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz asks Trump to "turn the temperature down" amid Insurrection Act threat
items.standfirst: In the wake of the latest wave of unrest in Minneapolis, President Trump is threatening to use the Insurrection Act to deploy troops to the city. Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is now making a direct appeal to the president. CBS News correspondent Lana Zak has the latest.
items.content: In the wake of the latest wave of unrest in Minneapolis, President Trump is threatening to use the Insurrection Act to deploy troops to the city. Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is now making a direct appeal to the president. CBS News correspondent Lana Zak has the latest.

items.title: Astronauts back on Earth after medical issue cut mission short

items.content: Four space station Crew 11 fliers splashed down off the Southern California coast at 3:41 a.m. ET, closing out a 167-day stay in space cut short by a medical issue.

items.title: Astronaut in "good spirits" after returning from ISS for unknown medical issue
items.standfirst: Four space station fliers undocked and plunged back to Earth, safely splashing down in the Pacific Ocean off the Southern California coast six days after NASA ordered them home early because of an unspecified medical issue. Mark Strassmann has details.
items.content: Four space station fliers undocked and plunged back to Earth, safely splashing down in the Pacific Ocean off the Southern California coast six days after NASA ordered them home early because of an unspecified medical issue. Mark Strassmann has details.

items.title: International Space Station astronauts back on Earth after first ever emergency return
items.standfirst: An astronaut who had a "serious medical condition" onboard the International Space Station is safely back on Earth, after the first-ever emergency return space flight.
items.content: An astronaut who had a "serious medical condition" onboard the International Space Station is safely back on Earth, after the first-ever emergency return space flight.

items.title: Watch: Astronauts return to Earth after medical evacuation

items.content: Four astronauts who left the International Space Station (ISS) a month early due to one of the crew members falling ill have returned to Earth on Thursday.

clusters.title: Trump says Gaza ‘board of peace’ formed as ceasefire enters next phase
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump says Gaza ‘board of peace’ formed as ceasefire enters next phase

items.title: Trump says Gaza ‘board of peace’ formed as ceasefire enters next phase
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had formed a Gaza “board of peace,” a phase two element of a US-backed plan to end the war in the Palestinian territory. The board will oversee a technocratic committee, led by Ali Shaath, an engineer and former Palestinian Authority official, tasked with managing post-war Gaza.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday he had formed a Gaza “board of peace,” a phase two element of a US-backed plan to end the war in the Palestinian territory. The board will oversee a technocratic committee, led by Ali Shaath, an engineer and former Palestinian Authority official, tasked with managing post-war Gaza.

items.title: Trump's Gaza peace plan enters second phase
items.standfirst: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday
items.content: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday

items.standfirst: Move comes as calls for Australia-style social media ban for under-16s grow around worldTikTok will begin to roll out new age-verification technology across the EU in the coming weeks, as calls for an Australia-style social media ban for under-16s grow in countries including the UK.ByteDance-owned TikTok, and other major platforms popular with young people such as YouTube, are coming under increasing pressure to better identify and remove accounts belonging to children. Continue reading...
items.content: Move comes as calls for Australia-style social media ban for under-16s grow around worldTikTok will begin to roll out new age-verification technology across the EU in the coming weeks, as calls for an Australia-style social media ban for under-16s grow in countries including the UK.ByteDance-owned TikTok, and other major platforms popular with young people such as YouTube, are coming under increasing pressure to better identify and remove accounts belonging to children. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Japan's Economic Security Minister Kimi Onoda announced on Friday that the country's Cabinet Office launched an investigation into X Corp. over its artificial intelligence chatbot Grok's alleged creat...

items.title: Japan probing Grok AI over inappropriate images

items.title: Musk’s Grok AI Faces Scrutiny From Japan Over Sexualized Images
items.standfirst: Japan joined the growing list of countries probing X over Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence service Grok and the chatbot’s role in creating and spreading sexualized images of people without their consent.
items.content: Japan joined the growing list of countries probing X over Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence service Grok and the chatbot’s role in creating and spreading sexualized images of people without their consent.

items.title: Ashley St. Clair Sues Elon Musk’s xAI Over Grok Sexual Images
items.standfirst: Ashley St. Clair, the mother of one of Elon Musk’s children, sued the billionaire’s artificial intelligence company for harassment, accusing xAI’s Grok chatbot of generating sexually explicit images of her without her consent.
items.content: Ashley St. Clair, the mother of one of Elon Musk’s children, sued the billionaire’s artificial intelligence company for harassment, accusing xAI’s Grok chatbot of generating sexually explicit images of her without her consent.

items.title: Philippines Bans Grok Website, Eyes X Talks as Backlash Grows
items.standfirst: The Philippines blocked access to the website of Elon Musk’s Grok artificial intelligence chatbot as a global backlash grows over sexualized images of people generated by the AI system.
items.content: The Philippines blocked access to the website of Elon Musk’s Grok artificial intelligence chatbot as a global backlash grows over sexualized images of people generated by the AI system.

items.title: South Africa Extends Deadline for Comments on Online-Betting Tax
South Africa Extends Deadline for Comments on Online-Betting Tax
items.standfirst: South Africa extended the deadline for public comment on a proposed 20% online-gambling tax due to requests for more time.
items.content: South Africa extended the deadline for public comment on a proposed 20% online-gambling tax due to requests for more time.

clusters.title: What will Europe actually do to defend Greenland?
clusters.neutral_headline: What will Europe actually do to defend Greenland

items.title: What will Europe actually do to defend Greenland?
items.standfirst: European countries – including France – have begun deploying troops to Greenland, in what Germany describes as a mission aimed at countering "Russian and Chinese threats". The White House says the show of unity for the Arctic island will have "no impact" on Trump's ambitions for it. It comes a day after high-level talks in Washington highlighted "fundamental disagreements" over the future of the Danish territory.
items.content: European countries – including France – have begun deploying troops to Greenland, in what Germany describes as a mission aimed at countering "Russian and Chinese threats". The White House says the show of unity for the Arctic island will have "no impact" on Trump's ambitions for it. It comes a day after high-level talks in Washington highlighted "fundamental disagreements" over the future of the Danish territory.

items.title: Denmark warns of 'fundamental disagreements' over Greenland after White House talks
items.standfirst: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".
items.content: The UK has deployed a military officer to Greenland as Denmark and its European allies seek to counter Donald Trump's threats to take the territory, after talks at the White House ended with "fundamental disagreement".
